```{r}
# Given data
row_total_private_school <- 112 # change this given data
column_total_love <- 77 # change this given data
grand_total <- 214 # change this given data

# Calculate the expected count
expected_count <- (row_total_private_school * column_total_love) / grand_total

# Print the result, rounded to 1 decimal place
expected_count <- round(expected_count, 1)
expected_count
```

```{r}
# Create the contingency table
# Matrix for the contingency table
data <- matrix(c(7, 8, 0, 15), nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE)
    colnames(data) <- c("Normalized", "Not Normalized")
    rownames(data) <- c("Prednisolone", "Control")
data

# Perform Fisher's exact test
fisher.test(data)
```

```{r}
# Create the contingency table
data <- matrix(c(17, 17, 9, 34), nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE,
               dimnames = list(Smoking = c("History of smoking", "Never smoked"),
                               MI_Status = c("Acute MI Cases", "Controls")))
data
# Perform Fisher's exact test
fisher.test(data)
```
